titles.title: National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2005
National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2005
National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2005
National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2005
To authorize appropriations for the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries and Oceans.
Subcommittee on Fisheries and Oceans Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-112.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 64.

action.text: Mr. Pearce moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1428.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe under authority of the order of the Senate of 07/29/2005 without amendment. With written report No. 109-127. Additional views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 198.

bill.summary: 8/31/2005--Reported to Senate without amendment. National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2005 - Amends the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act to reauthorize appropriations for the work of the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation through FY2010. Limits congressional notice requirements for Foundation grants to grants of federal funds in excess of $10,000. Authorizes the use of federal funds to match contributions made to Foundation grant recipients. Repeals provisions authorizing appropriations for the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation effective September 30, 2015.
